Detailed Description

Base class for image decoders, which are usually implemented as singleton. When starting the decoding, the data is protected by a semaphore automatically.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

ImageDecoder::ImageDecoder (  BOOLEAN  shared = TRUE,
const Ticks &  timeout = Ticks(200)
) 
 

Parameters:
shared If set to TRUE, the decoder is shared by several instances of an image. In this case ImageDecoder::BeginDecoding obtains the decoder with the given timeout. If set to FALSE each instance of an image owns an own instance of an image decoder and hence no obtaining is required.
timeout Timeout in milliseconds when trying to obtain the image decoder. The parameter is only respected if shared is set to TRUE. Note that when using Ticks::Infinite() the decoder should assure a very small decoding time.

ImageDecoder::~ImageDecoder (   )  [virtual]
 

Member Function Documentation

BOOLEAN ImageDecoder::BeginDecoding (  const Image &  image,
INT  frame_idx = 0
)  [virtual]
 

Usually this method is invoked inside Image::BeginScanlineDrawing and indicates, that the decoding process will be started. Hence all initializations for the decoder should be implemented by overwriting this method. If the image decoder is shared, the base implementation obtains a semaphore with the given timeout to have unique access to the data of the class. TRUE is returned, if the obtaining has been successful. Have a look at the constructor how to initialize the shared- and timeout-property.

void ImageDecoder::EndDecoding (  const Image &  image,
INT  frame_idx = 0
)  [virtual]
 

Usually this method is invoked inside Image::EndScanlineDrawing and indicates, that the decoding-process is finished. Hence freeing all needed resources for the decoder should be implemented by overwriting this method. The base-implementation releases the semaphore which has been obtained by invoking BeginDecoding.

virtual BOOLEAN ImageDecoder::GetMetaData (  Image &  image,
Image::MetaData *  meta_data
)  [pure virtual]
 

Returns the meta-data of an image into the output-parameter meta_data. Some image-decoders might require to start the decoding to get the image data. In this case don't forget to invoke the methods ImageDecoder::BeginDecoding and ImageDecoder::EndDecoding.
